summary: This document is a transcript of court proceedings from the Epstein case. The defense attorney moves for a mistrial, citing issues with witness testimony and the use of first names to protect alleged victims' identities. The judge denies the motion, provides a jury instruction explaining the name protection protocol, and directs the government to provide witnesses with a list of individuals whose identities are protected.

persons.name: Mr. Agnifilo
persons.context: Defense attorney who moves for a mistrial, objects to the judge's proposed jury instruction, and is directed not to make speaking objections.

persons.name: Denise Parisi
persons.context: Court reporter credited at the bottom of the transcript pages.

events.title: Defense Motion for Mistrial Denied
events.description: The defense attorney moves for a mistrial, citing issues with witness testimony and the protection of alleged victims' names. The judge denies the motion.

events.title: Jury Instruction on Name Protection
events.description: The judge provides a jury instruction explaining that alleged victims' full names are being withheld from the public/press for privacy, and that witnesses will use first names only or refer to a protected list.

keyFacts: The defense moved for a mistrial over procedural issues related to witness testimony and name protection, but the motion was denied.
The court is protecting the identities of alleged victims by having witnesses refer to them by first name only in open court.
The judge directed the government to provide witnesses with a list of individuals whose identities should be protected to avoid on-the-spot questions during testimony.
The judge instructed parties not to make speaking objections, requiring a sidebar if the basis for an objection isn't apparent.
